title: [noob question] someone picks adc, I pick bot ashe... adv gets very angry and nearly rage quits...
body:
{{champion:22}}  
Can someone explain to me why I a player who picked adc raged really hard when I picked bottom lane Ashe? (sorry for being a noob but I've only been playing for less than a month)
is there some kind of rule where only one member can carry or something? I don't know how to carry a game because I'm not very good. I main Ashe because she has a beginner skill cap but very good map presence (plus, I liked her backstory in the comics). As far as I know, there are five players:
one jungle,
one top lane, usually melee
one mid (I assume top, mid and jungle gets to soak up more exp during early game)
then, there's the bottom + support duo. I usually pick bottom since I prefer ranged and I welcome anyone who shares the lane with me be it support or not. 

so, this one guy (with the attitude of an infant) threatened to AFK after I locked in to ashe because no one called dibs on bot lane. he carried the game in the end which was what he intended to do. I played the game by supporting the team which was what I intended to do. So is there something about LOL roles etiquette that a nood like me should be aware of? (especially during MSI a lot of players are in a very competitive mood while I just want to have fun)

replies.body:
Just like in basketball, you don't expect the point guard to fight it out under the basket, or in hockey, you expect the goalie to stay back, protecting the goal, different champions favor different roles.

Yes, Ashe _can_ fill a support role, but most people expect her to fill the ADC.  Playing to the meta (expected role for the champion) simply makes it easier for a group of random players to know what to expect from each other.

Playing off-meta can work, but it requires better communication than most players use.

in league people have low tolerance for others.

there is a preferred set up much like in football there is a preferred set up.

however there's nothing in football saying that you cant have 11 linemen.

What exactly do you mean by map control?

* Some champions can place traps that linger after they leave the area, like Teemo
* Some champions can cast certain spells anywhere on the map (or within a very large range), like Karthus (Zeus ult) or Ziggs
* Some champions can teleport long distances, like Shen or Twisted Fate

LoL has actually been shrinking for around a year or two, but it's understandable because its peak playerbase (number of accounts, anyway) was huge.

Ashe support can work. It is not meta and it is not optimal, but it is not entirely impossible. Miss Fortune support is a better choice, in my opinion, if you want to play an ADC that is a support.

However, you mentioned that you wanted to carry as well but are bad at it.
The roles in League are not entirely hard-set as Riot has really mixed things up a lot over the last year (and do so randomly as well). However, in general, if you have two players actively trying to play carries (not carry and support-carry) in bot lane, you will lose hard. CS cannot be divided evenly and thus you will not have the gold required to keep up with an enemy ADC getting all the gold.

Meta is far less important at the very beginning but learning to play properly should start from the beginning. Mind, I do not mean properly in the sense that you have to pick top-tier champions. Quite the contrary, I would suggest the easier champions so you can get used to laning, trading and CSing and understand the basic matchups and such.

Ignore the flaming people. If you are are flaming a new player you are just terrible anyway.

I would strongly suggest to try out some champions as you can, pick up 1 or 2 and focus them as much as you can and it will help a ton.

Btw, just to let you know that there is no official thing as "calling dibs". Call order in blind pick is common courtesy,  and it's not a hard and fast rule that people have to follow. So people will never be punished if they don't follow it.
